title: Salsa Asada de Aguacate
source: Bricia Lopez, Javier Cabral - Asada: The Art of Mexican-Style Grilling
categories: Asada: The Art of Mexican-Style Grilling
ingredients: 14ounces (400 g) tomatillos, preferably the milapero variety, husked and rinsed
2cups (80 g) loosely packed fresh cilantro, leaves and tender stems only
directions: Start a charcoal or gas grill. Gas should be set to high. If using a pellet grill, preheat your grill to 425°F (220°C) for at least 15 minutes. If using charcoal, the coals should be red but entirely covered with gray ash.
Cook the tomatillos, serranos, and onion directly on the grill until their skins have charred evenly, about 7 to 15 minutes. Turn every 3 to 4 minutes for even cooking. Remove to a plate.

In a food processor, add the tomatillos, serranos, onion, garlic, cilantro, and salt. Pulse until a smooth paste forms, adding up to 2 tablespoons water to loosen the salsa as needed. Add the avocados and pulse again. Serve within 1 hour.
